title: How did the scientists know that the atoms of all matter have the same fundamental structure? - Quora

response.answer_text: That’s not the way science works. To know that, you would have to examine every atom in the universe. That’s not possible. Scientists don’t know that all atoms have the same fundamental structure. They do know that if they assume that all atoms have the same fundamental structure they can do a lot of useful things with that theory, and they have never found an atom with a different fundamental structure. How did the scientists know that the atoms of all matter have the same fundamental structure?
